trans-unit.source: Represents a control that has an intrinsic value that does not span a range and can be represented as a string.
This string may or may not be editable depending on the control and its settings.
Gets the cached [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] property values for this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern"></xref>.
Cached property values must have been previously requested using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>.
To get the value of a property at the current point in time, get the property by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.Current%2A>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.ValuePatternInformation>.
The cached property values.
The requested property is not in the cache.
Gets the current [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] property values for this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern"></xref>.
This pattern must be from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> with an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode.Full> reference in order to get current values.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> was obtained using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementMode.None>, it contains only cached data, and attempting to get the current value of any property raises an exception.
Use <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.Cached%2A> to get the cached value of a property that was previously specified using a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.CacheRequest>.
For information on the properties available and their use, see <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.ValuePatternInformation>.
The current property values.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.ValuePatternInformation.IsReadOnly"></xref> property.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePatternIdentifiers>.

A control should have its <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.IsEnabledProperty> set to `true` and its <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.IsReadOnlyProperty> set to `false` before a client attempts a call to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.SetValue%2A>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern"></xref> control pattern.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePatternIdentifiers>.

The pattern identifier is passed to methods such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.GetCurrentPattern%2A> to retrieve the control pattern of interest from the specified <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
Sets the value of the control.
Single-line edit controls support programmatic access to their contents through <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern>.

However, multi-line edit controls do not support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern>; instead they provide access to their content through the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>control pattern.
Value to set.
The UI Automation provider is responsible for converting the value to the appropriate data type.
The control is read-only.
The control is not enabled.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.ValuePatternInformation.Value"></xref> property.
This identifier is used by UI Automation client applications.
UI Automation providers should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePatternIdentifiers>.
